page.title: 03Cil-Y-Cwm
page.content: Economy-Social Life-Tourism The village of Cil-y-cwm lies in the Tywi Valley, 4 miles north of Llandovery. The population of the entire parish is less than 400. although predominantly an agricultural area, forestry and tourism also make a valuable contribution to the area's economy. Life revolves around a parish church, two chapels, a primary school, an old school which is used as a hall, and a pub. There is a small leather business and an antique restoratin enterprise. Although there is some concern about the way forestry has developed, the area may still be described as virtually unspoilt.
